intro: Borreria inaguensis, commonly known as the Inagua borreria, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Inagua. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and slender, woody stems. It thrives in coastal and sandy habitats, often found in dry, sunny environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
